alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 10:43PM EDT until June 16 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Escambia County in northwestern Florida... South Central Santa Rosa County in northwestern Florida... * Until 1245 AM CDT. * At 943 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Training storms will likely lead to continued flash flooding across the barrier islands including Gulf Shores and Pensacola Beach. Heavy rainfall rates could lead to rapid rises in poor drainage areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pensacola, Warrington, Gulf Breeze, Goulding, Oriole Beach, Pensacola Beach, Villa Sabine, Brownsville, Garcon Point, Beach Haven and Pleasant Grove. This includes the following streams and drainages... Carpenter Creek, Pensacola Bay, Bridge Creek and Bellshead Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
